reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZaQHD1OnV2w
Squares route is an interesting puzzle incorporating path finding and spacial awaeness mechanics, where you roll your cube around the level trying to squash the different coloured weeds.

This sounds simple in principle but when you take into account the fact that you can only squash a weed if the colour on the side of your cube that squashes the weed matches the colour of the weed.
Add to that not just awards for completing the level but also collecting all the gems and completing the level in the minimum moves possible you can very quickly find your brain melting out of your ears.

The learning curve on the game seems just about right by adding new mechanics every couple of levels

Overall a very good budget puzzle game with 100 levels to explore and complete

+ Simple gameplay mechanic
+ 100 levels and 4 different environment types
+ Replayability with additional goals on every level
+ Great Price

- Isometric perspective can cause some issues with accidently rolling your cube the wrong way
- Feels a little like a mobile port

Know your PathSometimes games can be very simple on their design, but still offer lot of complexity. Squares route is an indie game that has rather cool concept and makes you exercise your brain. It has controller support and simple stuff like resolutions etc.
However i do think mouse support would be nice for clearer gameplay (for lazy people too)

There is ton of difficulty as you progress throughout the game, even if you complete all 100 levels you can still beat them with 3 star rating. Plus the game is not expensive or anything so might as well give it a shot

reviewText: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=deKHP6-214c&feature=youtu.be\nFrom what I've played, I would recommend this title. It is colorful, has great graphics, relatively simple, and cheap. The puzzles are easy at first, but they do get harder as one progresses. I also like the catchy music in the background. The one thing I did not like is that you cannot look at the entire world map, which means that without reading the description in the Store Page I had no clue how many levels the game contained. All in all, I recommend this for puzzle lovers who want a cheap and enjoyable experience.
voteText: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This is a fantastic little puzzler and an incredible bargain at the price.

On first glance I was skeptical, as the cute pixelated graphics and seemingly simple gameplay (directing a cube around an isometric grid) suggested nothing more than a time waster that I'd finish in a couple of hours.  No chance!

Thankfully, the difficulty curve steps up gradually, eventually becoming rock hard, through the introduction of limited moves, different coloured sides which must be used to squish matching coloured plants, mined explosives, time limits, porcupine cubes that take you out along with other guard sentries etc.

Gameplay and controls (arrow keys) are really easy to pick up, but as each level becomes more and more intricate, you need to carefully plan and experiment to solve.  Getting past the next level feels really rewarding, while the pop synth soundtrack is also great addition.  Can't recommend this game more highly!

reviewText:
Fun and progressively morre challenging.  Pushed me on spatial thinking anticipating how to get the correct side of a cube at the correct location.  A 1-cell Rubik's cube!

I appreciate how you can make any level more challenging by going for additional challenges, or you can just complete the level and move on.

I hope there is a sequel

Puzzling at it's best. Simple, fast, fluid and fun. So gald to find that it's now available on steam, big surprise! Love the look and feel of the game, reminds me of some classic nintendo games, of old. Simply hooked on the simple mechanics, trying to get prefect on some of the later levels is keeping me in the game. Squash those evil plants!

reviewText:
First thing that hits you when you run this game is a big happy feeling right from the initial screen.  This continues throughout the game, thanks to lots of warm-hearted animations and little background flourishes that breathe life into the environment.

The music perfect matches the gameplay, it seems to get you into a puzzle solving rhythm and spur you along. Sound effects are well rounded and never annoying.

I liked the purity of the control mechanic. The challenges posed by the game purely come from the playful and challenging level design.  This makes it easy to pickup which maxmises its potential audience.  So many games get this wrong and end up complicating the controls (e.g. multiple action buttons) which just puts players off from the start.

What addicted me most was trying to get a perfect score. I was never satisfied with simply completing a level, I felt the need to prove myself to the game by sussing out the optimal route!

One of the puzzle themes is ensuring you use specific coloured sides of the cube to squash some enemies. This is nice as it gets you thinking spatially in 3 dimensions which feels like a mini-workout for the brain.

The whole experience is rounded off with nice soft damped player and camera motions.

reviewText: The biggest issues I have noticed is that when you play using a controller, you have a tendency to try to move diagonally since the level is viewed from an angle. this has caused me to accidentally move the wrong way a few times. You still only move the joystick up down left or right, even though your block ends up moving diagonally. Other than that the music is great and the game is a lot of fun.

A neat litte puzzler which is worth the small price. It's similar to some other games of this type but tries to add some variety with different type of environment, enemies etc.
Avg. game length should be around 4 to 6 hours (solid length for a 3 to 4 bucks game).
If you are into puzzle check it out!
